results.title: Punch press guarding
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and Industrial Accident Prevention Associations
results.brief_description: Shows management and employees that there is a guard to protect workers on every type of punch press and that protection is provided only when the guard is properly adjusted. The punch press has a record of producing more permanent disability injuries than any other industrial mechanical equipment. Shocking accidents are shown followed by examples of guards available and a clear statement of the foreman’s responsibility in preventing accidents.

results.title: Punch-drunk love = Punch drunk love
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Revolution Studios, New Line Cinema, Joanne Sellar, Daniel Lupi and Paul Thomas Anderson
results.brief_description: This is not a typical Adam Sandler comedy. Barry Egan (Sandler) is a novelty business owner who has seven sisters and is looking for love, (even trying phone sex once) but love finds him, sending his very ordered life upside down. Watching “Punch-drunk love” you find a mix of dark humour and seedy characters, coupled with violent behaviour and social dysfunction - but it’s also a romance with colour, mood and music that carries you along and makes you hope for a happy ending. Written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, winner of Best Director 2002 Cannes Film Festival for this disquieting film. Cast includes Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Luis Guzman.

results.title: Pumiceland
results.brief_description: The Central Plateau of the North Island of New Zealand was laid waste by a volcanic upheaval 2000 years ago and since then has remained a wasteland. This film tells the story of the attempts and final success of farmers and scientists to make it a productive area.

results.title: Pulse of life
results.creator_credit: David Adams, Pyramid Films and Frank Gardonyi
results.brief_description: The story of artificial respiration and artificial circulation from the earliest times, also detailed illustrations of modern methods of mouth to mouth resuscitation and heart massage. Emphasis is placed on diagnosis and treatment; distinguishing between unconsciousness and cardiac arrest; what happens when breathing and circulation stop; how to detect conditions which cause death. Presents procedures for treating a resuscitation emergency until the victim recovers or medical help is available.

results.title: Pulpy kidney, enterotoxaemia in sheep
results.brief_description: Details of the ravages caused to Australian sheep by the disease enterotoxaemia are graphically shown in this film. Methods of treatment and control are shown in detail and the need for prevention of this disease by vaccination is stressed.
results.description: Details of the ravages caused to Australian sheep by the disease enterotoxaemia are graphically shown in this film. Methods of treatment and control are shown in detail and the need for prevention of this disease by vaccination is stressed.

results.title: Pulp fiction [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Bender, A Band Apart, Jersey Films, Miramax Films and Quentin Tarantino
results.brief_description: Tarantino’s amoral black gangster movie pilfers cinematic conventions from a diverse range of sources: from Hong Kong karate cinema to Orson Welles, from Godard’s “Breathless” to B-grade film noir. The mix is intoxicating. Three pulpy stories form the centre of the film. John Travolta plays a mafia hood with a keen addiction to heroin, who is asked to entertain for an evening the girlfriend (Uma Thurman) of his mobster boss; Bruce Willis is an ageing boxer who is asked to throw a fight; and Travolta and Samuel Jackson have to hide the body of a conman they accidentally shot. Surrounding these basic plot contrivances Tarantino creates a charged, constantly shifting narrative that introduces highly eccentric characters drawn from the extremes of popular music, junk and drug culture. The supporting cast is astounding, from Harvey Keitel and Tarantino himself, to Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer’s surreal performance as amphetamine-hyped killers. By introducing peripheral subcultures to the Hollywood mainstream, Tarantino’s film marked a generational shift in American movies. Not the Vietnam generation but the video generation. (Awards: Winner of Palme d’Or, Cannes, 1994).

results.title: Pulleys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Illustrates a simple machine and, by explaining the principle of its operation, shows how pulleys make possible the lifting of heavy loads with a minimum of effort. Both the fixed pulleys , which changes the direction of force and the moveable pulleys which multiply force are examined in detail along with the block and tackle system. Shows the functions of different kinds if pulleys as they are seen in everyday use.

results.title: Puffins, predators and pirates
results.creator_credit: Nancy Archibald and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The picturesque biological study gives striking evidence of how as order can be a threat to an entire different species: in this case the relatively rare North Atlantic Penguin. High multiplication rate of herring gulls forces them to attack penguins homeward-bound from fishing trips to rob them of their catch.
